commit.message:
libvpd: Update Building rpms section in README

Add a missing step where we move dist-gzip file to SOURCES folder before
invoking rpmbuild to pick up correct source tar ball.

Suggested-by: Borislav Stoymirski <borislav.stoymirski@bg.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Mahesh Salgaonkar <mahesh@linux.ibm.com>

libvpd: Prevent adding duplicate entries in addDeviceSpecific() function

Currently, addDeviceSpecific() adds new 'DataItem' to the
'mDeviceSpecific' vector without checking for duplicates. This
vector can be further used by the front end tools to list vpd
information. If this vector has duplicate entries, then vpd
information for a specific device is listed more than once.

To fix this, prevent duplicate entries with the same 'ac' value
from being stored in the vector. Check if a 'DataItem' with
the same ac value already exists in the vector, and add the new
object to the vector only if no matching item is found.

Signed-off-by: Sathvika Vasireddy <sv@linux.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Mahesh Salgaonkar <mahesh@linux.ibm.com>

Merge pull request #4 from Vasireddy-Sathvika/ci_fixes

libvpd/travis: Switch to newer distros and add support for v3 tags

libvpd/travis: Add support for Travis v3 CI

Align repo Travis meta info to v3 supported tags.

Signed-off-by: Sathvika Vasireddy <sv@linux.ibm.com>

libvpd/travis: Switch from Ubuntu20.04 to Ubuntu23.10

Move to using latest Ubuntu23.10 distro to ensure we have all the
latest packages for travis CI builds.

Signed-off-by: Sathvika Vasireddy <sv@linux.ibm.com>

libvpd/travis: Switch from Fedora33 to Fedora37

There have been CI failures with Fedora33 docker container. Move to
using latest Fedora37 distro to ensure we have all the latest packages
for travis CI builds.

Signed-off-by: Sathvika Vasireddy <sv@linux.ibm.com>

libvpd v2.2.9 release notes

Major changes since v2.2.9
  - VpdDbEnv: Add locking fo the database file.
  - Update libtool version info

Signed-off-by: Michal Suchanek <msuchanek@suse.de>
Signed-off-by: Mahesh Salgaonkar <mahesh@linux.ibm.com>

Update libtool version info

The recent locking changes to protect vpd database file from corruption
has introduced ABI changes by addition of new class members/functions to
libvpd. This change in API/ABI of libvpd brings binary incompatibility
for existing installed lsvpd tools causing vpdupdate to crash. Hence it
is necessary to bump up the shared library version to address binary
incompatibility issues.

The current libvpd packaging uses the same version numbers for package
release as well as for ABI versioning. Introduce a separate version
number for library ABI version for better ABI compatibility management.

Currently library ABI version is set by libtool --version-number option
which uses current package version major:minor:micro and release info is
set to major:minor and we get library name as: libvpd_cxx-2.2.so.2 ->
libvpd_cxx-2.2.so.2.2.8

To bump up the ABI version of the library from 2 to 3 will require bumping
up the package major version. Using libtool versioning info will help us
to keep package release version and ABI version separate.

The current library ABI version is 2, hence start with ABI version 3:0:0
and update it as per guideline at
https://www.gnu.org/software/libtool/manual/html_node/Updating-version-info.html

Signed-off-by: Mahesh Salgaonkar <mahesh@linux.ibm.com>

Merge pull request #7 from hramrach/master

Fix database locking

commit.message:
vpddbenv: Add locking of the database file.

vpupdate removes the database file. Add a lock outside of the SQLite API
to make it possible to lock removal of the file against other processes
updating it.

Signed-off-by: Michal Suchanek <msuchanek@suse.de>

vpddbenv: Use sqlite3_open_v2 to pass on readonly flag.

SQLite supports readonly flag with sqlite3_open_v2. Use this interface
to pass on the readOnly flag.

Signed-off-by: Michal Suchanek <msuchanek@suse.de>

vpddbenv: Add busy timeout handling to SQLite calls.

There is nothing stopping the user from running multiple lsvpd commands
in parallel, and lsvpd logs an error without giving useful results in
this case. Add a timeout (infinite for now) to SQLite calls.

Signed-off-by: Michal Suchanek <msuchanek@suse.de>

vpddbenv: Remove superfluous copy constructor definition.

According to the comment the code would not compile if the constructor
is not defined even if it cannot be used. It compiles without the
definition.

Signed-off-by: Michal Suchanek <msuchanek@suse.de>

vpddbenv_c: fix compile warnings

src/vpddbenv_c.c: In function 'new_vpddbenv':
src/vpddbenv_c.c:56:17: warning: 'strncat' specified bound 1 equals source length [-Wstringop-overflow=]
   56 |                 strncat( ret->fullPath, "/" , 1 );
      |                 ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
src/vpddbenv_c.c:58:17: warning: 'strncat' accessing between 258 and 9223372036854775804 bytes at offsets 514 and 257 may overlap 1 byte at offset 514 [-Wrestrict]
   58 |                 strncat( ret->fullPath, ret->dbFileName, strlen(ret->dbFileName) );
      |
                        ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

While compiling the code with GCC-11 (Fedora 34), the GCC complains
about src string length and N bytes mentioned in the strncat() are of
same length. It gets suspicious, when strncat() mimics strcat(), the
strcat() was replaced using strncat() by the commit 38de4e65205
("libvpd: Convert strcat to strncat") as part of secure coding.

refactor the code using snprintf(), making the code lean and keep the
GCC happy as well.

Signed-off-by: Kamalesh Babulal <kamalesh@linux.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Remove dynamic exception specification

Tomasz Koczko reported that the build fails, while compiling
with GCC 11:

In file included from src/vpdretriever.cpp:25:
./src/libvpd-2/vpdretriever.hpp:62:33: error: ISO C++17 does not allow dynamic exception specifications
   62 |                                 throw( VpdException& );
      |                                 ^~~~~
./src/libvpd-2/vpdretriever.hpp:74:33: error: ISO C++17 does not allow dynamic exception specifications
   74 |                                 throw( VpdException& );
      |                                 ^~~~~
src/vpdretriever.cpp:50:37: error: ISO C++17 does not allow dynamic exception specifications
   50 |                 string dbFileName ) throw( VpdException& )
      |                                     ^~~~~
src/vpdretriever.cpp:62:39: error: ISO C++17 does not allow dynamic exception specifications
   62 |         VpdRetriever::VpdRetriever( ) throw( VpdException& )
      |                                       ^~~~~
make: *** [Makefile:660: src/vpdretriever.lo] Error 1

As part of
http://www.open-std.org/jtc1/sc22/wg21/docs/papers/2016/p0003r5.html,
the dynamic exception specification have been removed. Remove the
throw specifier, to specify that the function might throw an exception.

Signed-off-by: Kamalesh Babulal <kamalesh@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

travis: replace Fedora rawhide with Fedora 33

There have been CI failures with Fedora rawhide Docker images and it
turns out that upstream Docker image repository is not building ppc64le
Fedora rawhide and Fedora 34 Docker images. For details see:
https://github.com/docker-library/official-images/commit/f7c0d815ff9885b28e3b5a522b2c9bc9029943c9

For now, let keep travis happy with switch over to Fedora 33.

Signed-off-by: Kamalesh Babulal <kamalesh@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

libvpd v2.2.8 release notes

Major changes since v2.2.7:
  - VpdDbEnv: Make the sqlite operations asynchronous
    This will improve `vpdupdate` performance quite a bit.

Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Add ubuntu 20.04

Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Fix travis build failures

Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

VpdDbEnv: Make the sqlite operations asynchronous

If we use syncrhonous=OFF, the time taken to inserting into the DB
is significantly reduced with safety of data except during OS crashes.
If the pragma is unsupported, the pragma is ignored by the sqlite and
no error/warning displayed with no side effect on the opened handle.

The vpdupdate's most of overhead being the data insertion, this
change makes it return very faster.

Signed-off-by: Shivaprasad G Bhat <sbhat@linux.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

libvpd v2.2.7 release notes

Major changes since v2.2.6:
  - Add Travis build support
  - Reduce system load from vpdupdate udev rule

Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Add Travis configuration

This will allow Travis CI (https://travis-ci.org) to build and run the
tests.

The current patch enables the basic build checks. The future patches will
enable tests.

Signed-off-by: Shivaprasad G Bhat <sbhat@linux.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Fix specfile

Commit 2aa0065 fixed Source0 directive to use github format tarball.
But this fails when we create tarball using `make dist-gzip`.

This patch fixes above mentioned issue.

Fixes: https://github.com/power-ras/libvpd/issues/2
Reported-by: Michael Bringmann <mwb@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

udev rules: don't generate multiple vpdupdate events for SCSI/NVMe

lsvpd lists SCSI devices, not partitions or block devices. Currently,
addition of e.g. /dev/sda will generate events for a "scsi_device",
"scsi_disk", "bsg", and "block" device, plus events for partitions,
and every event will trigger a "touch /run/run.vpdupdate" command,
where touching the file once would be obviously sufficient. Add rules
that touch vpdupdate for SCSI hosts and devices, but not for the
additional sysfs nodes.

Similar reasoning for NVMe.

Signed-off-by: Martin Wilck <mwilck@suse.com>
Tested-by: Shivaprasad G Bhat <sbhat@linux.ibm.com>
[Added missing s-o-b - Vasant]
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

udev rules: more software devices to ignore

Additional subdirectories under /sys/devices that don't contain
nodes usable for vpdupdate.

Signed-off-by: Martin Wilck <mwilck@suse.com>
Tested-by: Shivaprasad G Bhat <sbhat@linux.ibm.com>
[Added missing s-o-b - Vasant]
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

udev rules: don't touch run.vpdupdate for ignored devices

vpdupdate ignores certain sysfs devices. It's pointless to trigger
VPD database updates from uevents for these devices.

Signed-off-by: Martin Wilck <mwilck@suse.com>
Tested-by: Shivaprasad G Bhat <sbhat@linux.ibm.com>
[Added missing s-o-b - Vasant]
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Fix the Source URL to point to tarball

The spec file expects the <>.tar.gz for the package.

Update the Source path to point to the particular release version
tarball downloadable from github. Though the path is ignored by
rpmbuild, only name is considered.

Signed-off-by: Shivaprasad G Bhat <sbhat@linux.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Update source URL to github location

As the source is getting moved to github, update the README file
and the spec with the new source location information.

Also, update the README file with the new guidelines on ways to
contact and contribute with github supported workflow.

Signed-off-by: Shivaprasad G Bhat <sbhat@linux.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Re-word the vpdupdate multiple instance error message

Re-word the error message throw to the user, when vpdupdate is executed
in parallel to another instance of vpdupdate.

Cc: Sourabh Jain <sourabhjain@linux.ibm.com>
Cc: Vaibhav Jain <vaibhav@linux.ibm.com>
Cc: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Kamalesh Babulal <kamalesh@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>

Imporve error message during mutiple instances of vpdupdate

When multiple instances of vpdupdate runs, only one will get
the access to the database others will get SQLITE_BUSY error
code.

Currently, the error message returned against the SQLITE_BUSY
error is "database is locked" which does not describe the problem
properly.

The database lock situation occurs when an operation could not
continue because of the conflict within the same database connection.
In the case of multiple vpdupdate instances, the database operation is
denied because the database is busy with some other process.

This patch adds a handler for SQLITE_BUSY error to log the appropriate
error message when multiple vpdupdate instances run simultaneously.

Signed-off-by: Sourabh Jain <sourabhjain@linux.ibm.com>
Reviewed-by: Vaibhav Jain <vaibhav@linux.ibm.com>
Signed-off-by: Vasant Hegde <hegdevasant@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
